answers.answer: There can be many causes, including serious ones like diabetes and thyroid disease.  Most guys ignore any other symptoms they have until they start having symptoms with erections, so there is nothing unusual about seeing the doctor for ED.  Get checked out with your PCP, and if necessary, referral to a urologist specializing in ED.In general, if you smoke, stop because it ruins your vascular system and therefore erections.  Eat a healthy diet, not one high in the wrong fats and carbs and sugar.  If you wear out your pancreas, you get type 2 diabetes, and diabetes is very bad for erections.Exercise vigorously, such as running.  Start with walking if that's all you can do.Take L-argimine to ramp up your testosterone and vascular system and make the exercise even more effective.Occasionally it is psychological, especially if you have a very religious background that says sex is dirty.  I hope that hasn't happened to you, but I'm sure it can be overcome.

question: I have only had sex with one girl my whole life alot and now I am been with this new girl for a year and we started doing everything but when it comes time to put it in I just can't keep it up but one time this happened with the first girl and once we got it in when it was a little hard it stayed up and everything went well and normal its just kepping it up before hand of putting it in, and the girl I am with now is a virgin but idk if that matters but if it helps so was the first girl. What could be happening to me?
title: I can't keep it up...
